articles.title: Social jetlag is associated with worse cognitive performance in children with ADHD - PsyPost
articles.description: Greater social jetlag, not sleep time or disturbances, correlates with lower cognitive performance in children with ADHD, according to new research. Consistent sleep routines could potentially enhance cognitive functions.
articles.content: A study examining children with ADHD found that a greater discrepancy in sleep time between school nights and weekend nights, known as social jetlag, correlates with poorer cognitive functioning. Tim… [+4789 chars]
